VIMWiki Markdown Formatting [VIM]
---------------------------------
.-----------------------------------------------.
| Text Formatting     | Command                 |
|-----------------------------------------------|
| Header1             | = around text           |
| Header2             | == around text          |
| Header3             | === around text         |
| Bold                | * around text           |
| Italic              | _ around text           |
| Link                | Double [Link]           |
| Link w/ Description | Double [Link<pipe>Desc] |
|-----------------------------------------------|
| Lists               | Command                 |
|-----------------------------------------------|
| Bullet Lists        | Alternate * and -       |
| Numbered Lists      | Alternate #) and a)     |
'-----------------------------------------------'


EVERY-DAY VIM SHORTCUTS [VIM]
-----------------------------
.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------.
| Shortcut | Function                                                                          |
|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| o        | Enter INSERT MODE below current line                                              |
| O        | Enter INSERT MODE above current line                                              |
| gg=G     | Auto-indent the whole buffer                                                      |
| gi       | Jump to the last edited line and enter INSERT MODE                                |
| zz       | Center the current line on the screen                                             |
| /        | Search forward in text                                                            |
| ?        | Search backward in text                                                           |
| ci"      | Change text inside quotes                                                         |
| *        | Search for the current word under the cursor                                      |
| Ctrl+o   | Go back through the jump list (do twice when opening a file to jump to last edit) |
| Ctrl+i   | Go forward through the jump list                                                  |
| Ctrl+j   | Jump to the definition of the highlighted method (requires ctags)                 |
| ~        | Toggle case                                                                       |
| I        | Enter INSERT MODE at the beginning of a line                                      |
| A        | Enter INSERT MODE at the end of a line                                            |
| gf       | Open the highlighted file under the cursor                                        |
| y        | In visual mode, 'yank' selected text to the vim clipboard                         |
| "*y      | Same as 'y' but it compies to your system clipboard                               |
| %        | Jump to the matching bracket
| $        | Move to the end of the current line                                               |
| 0        | Move to the beginning of the current line                                         |
'----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------'


VIMRC SETTINGS [VIM]
--------------------
.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------.
| Vim Setting                    | Description                                                 | Essential |
|--------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|
| set nocompatible               | Disregard 'vi' compatibility because reasons.               | Yes       |
| set showcmd                    | Show partial commands in the status line.                   | No        |
| set showmatch                  | Highlight matching brackets.                                | Yes       |
| set smartcase                  | Lowercase queries default to being case insensitive.        | Yes       |
| set incsearch                  | Turn on incremental searching.                              | Yes       |
| set mouse=a                    | Turn on basic mouse support.                                | No        |
| set number                     | Enable line numbering.                                      | Yes       |
| set relativenumber             | Line numbers are displayed relative to the cursor position. | Yes       |
| set numberwidth=5              | Set the width of the number column.                         | Yes       |
| set autoindent                 | Keep recent indentation position on new lines.              | Yes       |
| set expandtab                  | Use spaces instead of tabs.                                 | Yes       |
| set tabstop=4                  | Set tab width to 4 spaces.                                  | Yes       |
| set shiftwidth=4               | Set default indentation to 4 spaces.                        | Yes       |
| set hlsearch                   | Highlight search results in text.                           | Yes       |
| set ruler                      | Show cursor position in bottom right corner.                | No        |
| set wildmenu                   | Show a visual menu for funtion completion.                  | Yes       |
| set curcorline                 | Highlight the current line.                                 | Yes       |
| set title                      | Set the terminal title to the current filename.             | No        |
| set confirm                    | Enable save prompt when closing unsaved buffers.            | Yes       |
| set encoding=utf-8             | Set encoding to utf-8 by default.                           | Yes       |
| set backspace=indent,eol,start | Backspace all the things!                                   | Yes       |
| set splitbelow                 | New splits always render beneath the current buffer.        | Yes       |
| set clipboard=unnamed          | Use the system clipboard instead of VIM's clipboard.        | Yes       |
| set clipboard=unnamedplus      | Use the system clipboard instead of VIM's clipboard.        | Yes       |
| set laststatus=2               | Always display the status bar.                              | Yes       |
| set colorcolumn=80             | Display a column 'x' characters out to monitor line length. | No        |
| set spell                      | Check spelling and mark misspelled words.                   | No        |
| nnoremap <C-p> :wincmd p<CR>   | Remap Ctrl+p to switch between splits.                      | Yes       |
'----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------'
